utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! I just got uh, my teacher evaluations! Check out what this one student wrote, "I loved Dr. Geller’s class. Mind blowing lectures! Dr. Geller, you are definitely the hottie of the paleontology department!"

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ahh, Hotties of the Paleontology Department, there’s a big selling calendar, eh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Who wrote it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I wish I knew, but the evaluations are all anonymous.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh hey, do you still have their final exams?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, ‘cause you can just match the evaluation to the exam with the same handwriting and boom, there’s your admirer.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: A hot girl’s at stake and all of the sudden he’s Rain Man.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, wait a minute, wait a minute, why are we so sure that this is a girl?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s a girl! Anyway, it wou—it wouldn’t matter. Okay? Because I’m a teacher and she’s a student.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, is that against the rules?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, but it is frowned upon.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I see.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Besides, there’s a big age difference.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, well think of it like this, when you’re 90…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know when I’m 90 she’ll be like 80 and it won’t seem like such a big difference.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No that’s not what I was going to say at all. No, what I was going to say is when you’re 90 you’ll still have the memory of what it was like to be with a 20-year-old.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Chandler! Y’know that girl you went to college with who-who became a movie director?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah, Dana Keystone. She was in my Movement class.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What’s a Movement class?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s Chandler’s way of pretending he didn’t take mime.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh well listen, anyway she’s directing the new Al Pacino movie. You gotta get me an audition!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know man. I haven’t talked to her in like ten years.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no-no, please-please Chandler I-I-I would owe you so much!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You do owe me so much. You owe me three thousand, four hundred…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey dude, why are you changing the subject? Why? Will you make the call or what?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh okay, I’ll-I’ll try.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right! Thanks! You’re the best! Now listen, the last day of auditions is Thursday. Okay? So I gotta get in there by Thursday. Okay? Just remember Thursday. Thursday. Can you remember Thursday?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah so, Tuesday?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thursday! Look if you need help remembering think of like this, the third day. All right? Monday, one day. Tuesday, two day. Wednesday, when? Huh? What day? Thursday! The third day! Okay?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey Mon? I’m gonna check my messages.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You just thought of that in there?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah sure, nature called, she wanted to see who else did.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello? Uh, Rachel. Great, someone is in our apartment. Call the cops!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re on the phone!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Oh my God! Thank you! That was the fire department, there was a fire at our place!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! How bad was it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, he didn’t say, but it was a fire. I’m guessing not very good. Come on, we gotta go!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come on!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you smiling about? What is so funny?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The part I want to audition for is a fireman, this is so meant to be!

utterance.speaker: Burt
utterance.content: Wow! It looks like you were very generous with your grades this semester!

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Professor Geller?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: I wanted to say how much I enjoyed your class.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh thank you. Thanks very much. Ow!

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Uh, I’m a little embarrassed about calling you a hottie on my evaluation…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That was you?

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Yeah. I felt a little weird about it. You’re a teacher. I’m a student. But would you maybe want to go out with me sometime?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh I, I don’t-I don’t think that would be the best idea.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Oh, because I was thinking, the semester’s over; you’re not my teacher anymore.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What time?

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Oh, y’know what? Forget it, you already gave me an A.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Gotcha.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: I’m kidding!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh! So-so seriously, what time?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Coming through! Oh! Coming through! Oh! Hello! Hi! No! Right! Coming through!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh well, it’s not so bad.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: My God!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey buddy, do you think I can borrow your uniform this Thursday?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey! He’s working! You would look good in that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, how bad is it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, it’s bad. It’s really bad. The only thing in there that isn’t burned is an ass. Which I do not remember buying!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How’s your room Rach?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Everything’s ruined. My bed. My clothes. Look at my favorite blue sweater.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Isn’t that mine?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Fine! I’m sorry for your loss!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! Oh-okay, look pal, I am not in the mood to be hit on right now! But if you give me your number I will call you some other time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes, they can stay with us.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Have you figured out what started the fire Mr. Fireman?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, not usually. But yeah, I could use one right now.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes! I do! All the time! I love them! Oh my God! I did it! It’s me! It’s me! I burned down the house! I burned down the house!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay Phoebe calm down, there’s no need to place blame. Okay? I warned her about those candles.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: God, it’s great to catch up! I can’t believe how long it’s been!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Chandler, is that…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh that’s great! Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey listen…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay! So yeah, maybe we can get together umm… Can you hold for one second please? What?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: When you’re off the phone, do you wanna get a pizza?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi! I’m back. Yeah, that sounds great. Okay. Well, we’ll do it then. Okay, bye-bye.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey listen, so when’s-when’s my audition? I mean I know it’s Thursday, but what time?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We didn’t get to the audition. I’m gonna take her to coffee and then we’ll do it then.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah-ha!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! So, now you’re going on a date with this girl?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey, it is not a date! I haven’t talked to her in ten years! You can’t just call up somebody you haven’t talked to in ten years and ask them for a favor. There are rules, y’know? You gotta, you got to put in some time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re right, I’m sorry. It’s not like you’re y’know, going out with an ex-girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, we only went out once.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You dated her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Not once!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, well why don’t I go out with an ex-boyfriend and do Joey a favor?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, you wanna do Joey a favor, maybe you go out with Joey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh that’s great, my friend Joey’s in the movie business.

utterance.speaker: Dana
utterance.content: Y’know who I ran into from school? Howie.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: My friend’s name is Joey.

utterance.speaker: Dana
utterance.content: Apparently Howie’s editing now. Yeah, he-he-he calls me up and asks me if he can edit my new movie. Can you believe that?! Y’know I-I-I haven’t spoken to him in like ten years and he asks me for a favor!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve always hated that Howie.

utterance.speaker: Dana
utterance.content: No, no "How you doing?" Man, I mean not even a cup of coffee first!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The nerve huh?

utterance.speaker: Dana
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Refill?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now, this is last minute so I want to apologize for the mess. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! It sure didn’t look this way when I lived here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know! Now look, there’s only one problem though. There’s only room for one, so I guess one of you will have to stay at Joey’s.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, since the fire was kinda my fault I guess you should get to stay here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! Hey-hey, now this was no one’s fault Pheebs. Okay? It was an accident.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well no, it was my fault so you should get the nice room.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So Rach! You’re the first guest at Hotel Monica! Umm, you’ll just have to tell me how you like your eggs in the morning. And I thought I would bring them to you, y’know, in bed. Oh, you have been through so much.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I have.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This right here is where I keep the pizza. And uh that’s where the napkin is.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What’s that smell?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Oh please! It was such a big class! You never even noticed me!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? Of course I did! You uh, you sat next to Sleepy Sleeperson.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh uh, I had trouble remembering everyone’s name, so I-I kinda came up with nicknames. Like the guy on the other side of you was Smelly von Brownshirt.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Oh yeah. So umm, did you have a nickname for me?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Umm, no. No.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Yes you did! What was it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Umm, it’s Cutie McPretty.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Ohh that’s so sweet!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Listen, I gotta tell ya, I-I’m having a great time! Y’know how before you said it might be weird, the whole student teacher thing, and to be frank I thought it would be too, but it’s not. I mean it’s not at all.

utterance.speaker: Burt
utterance.content: Dr. Geller!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Burt!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So did you sleep well last night?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I did, Monica was so sweet she left a little mint on my pillow.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y’know what Joey left on my pillow?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Gum!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah I know, it was my candle. My candle!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t use a curling iron.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, don’t look at me! My hair’s straight! Straight! Straight! Straight!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This is where I keep the pizza. And—Hey! Where did the napkin go?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now there you go! I wouldn’t want my best guest to strain her eyes!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thanks Monica!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Does that smell bother you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What the smell from Joey’s? No, I can hardly smell it over here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well you let me know if you can, because y’know I can bake a pie to cover it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can smell it a little, bake the pie.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hello? Oh yes, one minute please. It’s for you. It’s the fire inspector.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Hello? Yeah this is Phoebe. Really?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, so it turns out that it wasn’t the hair straightener that started the fire. No-no, it was the candles. It’s very not good leaving candles unattended. In fact, one of the first things they teach you in fire school is… Uhh… Uhh… Okay. Well, I have to go now.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We had such a great time! She’s-she’s incredible! I thought the-the age difference might be a problem, but it wasn’t. It wasn’t at all. Elizabeth is very mature for her age. A concept lost on some people!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So it’s okay to date a student.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, not really. I mean technically it’s-it’s not against the rules or anything, but it is frowned upon. Especially by that professor we ran into last night, Judgey von Holierthanthou.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well Ross, you be careful now. You don’t want to get a reputation as y’know Professor McNailshisstudents.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. What-what should I do?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well Ross, it seems pretty clear. I mean what’s more important? What people think or how you feel, huh? Ross, you gotta follow your heart.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey that is so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey-hey! So, how did it go with Dana? Any reason I should leave a block of time open say Thursday?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I couldn’t do it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You couldn’t do it?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, relax I just need more time. We’re going to dinner tonight.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! You’re going out with her again!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Going out with who?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh, Dana Keystone from college.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah! Wasn’t she uh…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, that was Dana Caplin.

utterance.speaker: The Guys
utterance.content: Ohhhh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey! You didn’t even know her!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah whatever!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Great story again! The yarns that you weave! Woo-hoo-hoo!

utterance.speaker: Dana
utterance.content: Y’know uh, actually I-I-I should get going.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no! Stay! Stay! Because you-you should you-you-you should stay!

utterance.speaker: Dana
utterance.content: Wow. Oh, I am really flattered, but I just I don’t feel that way about you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no, that’s not—No-no-no!

utterance.speaker: Dana
utterance.content: I’m sorry Chandler, y’know you are such a sweet guy and I, I don’t want to hurt you. Oh, I wish there was something I can do to make you feel better.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-no—Really?!

utterance.speaker: Dana
utterance.content: Of course!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, it just hurts so bad. I uh…

utterance.speaker: Dana
utterance.content: Ohh, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well maybe there is one thing you can do.

utterance.speaker: Dana
utterance.content: What?! Anything! Anything!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I umm, I mean this is just off the top of my head now, umm but I have this friend. This actor friend and he would kill me if he thought I was doing this umm, but umm would it be possible for him to get an audition for your movie say on Thursday?

utterance.speaker: Dana
utterance.content: Absolutely! But you-you would really feel better about me rejecting you if your actor friend can audition for my movie?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, the heart wants what it wants. I’ll see you later.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey! How’s it goin’?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, not much has changed in the last five minutes.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes it has! I made cookies!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh that’s all right. I’m still full from your homemade potato chips.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But you should eat them now because they’re hot from the oven.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh-ho! But not in here! Can’t eat ‘em in bed, remember? No crumbies!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll be out in a second.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That doesn’t lock does it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Joey! Sorry!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No that’s all right. Don’t worry about it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh but look! That’s gonna leave a stain!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Rach! Hey! It’s fine! You’re at Joey’s!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Look!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’ve never lived like this before.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, don’t waste it, I mean its still food.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What do you want to do now? Huh? You wanna go get a drink?

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Uhh, I can’t.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, you have some studying to do?

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: No, I have some turning 21 to do.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know I remember when uh, when I was in college, we used to…

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nothing, I’m-I’m just, I’m so comfortable with you!

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Do you not want to be seen with me?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? No! Of course, of course I do! Are-are they gone?

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Uh no, they’re still here but I think I’m about to leave.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?! No! No! Wait! You’re right, this is stupid. Who cares what people think? I mean, I mean we like each other right? There’s nothing wrong with that. Come on. Burt? Lydia? Mel? This is Elizabeth.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Aren’t you in my Popular Culture class?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s right Lydia, Elizabeth here is a student and uh, we’re dating. And you may frown upon that, but we’re not gonna hide it anymore.

utterance.speaker: Mel
utterance.content: You are so fired.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Burt
utterance.content: They’re gonna fire you! You can’t date a student! It’s against the rules.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really? Its not just frowned upon?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I love it at Joey’s!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, here you go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ni-hi-ice!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, you busy Thursday?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, very funny. I don’t know if you remember, but my audition was supposed to be Thursday. You got me the audition?! Let’s hug it up!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. What are you gonna do to me if you get the part?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Listen umm, yeah okay, I need to talk to you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Now I know that they said that the umm, the hair straightener started the fire but I think I’m partly at fault. You see, I didn’t, I didn’t tell you but umm, but I-I had recently refilled the tissues and so y’know let’s just face it, that’s just kindling! So I think it’s better that I stay at Joey’s.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, no-no-no. Phoebe, this was my fault and besides y’know what? I’m fine here.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. Oh umm, Chandler, Monica is looking for you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah she said something about crumbies.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No! No! No! I was so careful!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, you have to switch with me! Monica is driving me crazy!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s right, all the ladies want to stay at Joey’s.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! No! Phoebe, come on! I don’t want to switch! Please come on! I can throw wet paper towels here!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No but at Monica’s you can eat cookies over the sink!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right fine! This looks like so much fun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: God, what a mess.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow! It actually is in the handbook. I can’t date you or have a hot plate in my office. I can’t believe we have to stop seeing each other.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: For what it’s worth I did appreciate you standing up for me. It felt really nice. It kinda made me like you even more.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know, I know I really like you too. But we-we can’t date. It’s against the rules. It’s forbidden.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Just hearing you describe it as forbidden, it’s really hot.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well I-I-I don’t care how hot it is it’s-it’s uh, it’s wrong.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Stop it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! No! It’s wrong! It’s-it’s-it’s naughty. It’s taboo.

utterance.speaker: Elizabeth
utterance.content: Shut the book!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Let’s also get a hot plate!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s Thursday! How was the audition?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wh? Monday, one day. Tuesday, two day. Wednesday, when huh what? Thurs— Oh!
